thread.title: Carson drops $500k ad buy in early primary states
thread.title_full: Carson drops $500k ad buy in early primary states | Washington Examiner

author: Al Weaver
title: Carson drops $500k ad buy in early primary states
text:
Ben Carson has taken over the lead in Iowa, and now he's taking his message to the air.
According to NBC News , the Carson campaign has made a $500k ad buy starting Friday in Iowa, New Hampshire, South Carolina and Nevada.
The ad buy consists of two commercials, one introducing him to the GOP electorate and the other calling out Washington as a "swamp." Both ads end with the campaign's slogan: Heal, Inspire, Revive.
In the introductory ad, Carson says that people "are hungry for some honesty and for some real solutions to the problems that ail us."
  Clinton wins endorsement from major public-sector union AFSCME A union for state and local government workers says she has the best chance among labor-friendly candidates.
By Sean Higgins â€¢ 10/23/15 1:41 PM The announcement comes on the heels of two consecutive polls showing Carson topping the GOP field in Iowa and overtaking Donald Trump, who had held the lead in the Hawkeye State since July. Nationally, Carson still trails Trump by six perentage points, 27-21, according to the latest RealClearPolitics national average.
Carson also sits second in the Washington Examiner 's latest power rankings .
